Description: "I always wanted to be a gangster" - thinking in four parts of worthy but futile endeavors and unattainable satisfaction. Playing with Tarantino style of humor (with the exception of intentional rudeness), director and screenwriter Samuel Banshetri creates, with the participation of unexpected characters, refined and beautiful toy.

Bandit pulled on a stocking on his head, crashed into a pole, but this time at the cafe that he still intends to rob, although the waitress really do not pay attention to his threats, old men sitting company. In the past they were robbers, and the wreck is now concerned about the problems of health and pension benefits, and on-site shelters, where they are thirty years ago hiding from the police, flaunts a bar. Later visit here rockers, stealing each other's songs and women, and the kidnappers, who were not lucky to take hostage the gloomy girl emo, norovyaschy, is to turn away, to bring to life scores.

Wonderful picture using the entire battery of styles, including flashbacks, shot in an accelerated manner of a silent movie. A variety of methods of work and does not seem to flickering as Benshetri creates the mood for each passage through, as operator of receptions (Pierre Em takes honed shots with a masterful use of space) as well as a wide selection of music - from Schubert to Kris Kristofferson, which also helps build a relationship of short stories from the first to the last. French absurdist noir comedy in the style of "Coffee and Cigarettes" by Jim Jarmusch
